reviews.text: And if you are considering booking with Choice Holidays - I suggest you don't. Their website describes it as a modern newly built hotel - it is most definately not! Also, our airport transfers for our return home did not arrive.
reviews.title: Both pools were too cold to use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we called the Malta Reps Office, we were told it's his day off, and offered no help. We contacted the transfer bus company who informed us that they had not been booked. Instead we made our own way to the airport. On our return to the UK, afer chasing a refund with Mike at Choice Holidays we were accused of lying.
reviews.title: Good choice of hotel, would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only back a couple of days from our stay at the Bella Vista, i went with my boyfriend and another couple. We arrived at 10pm to a very helpful guy at reception who explained everything to us and how our all inclusive worked. As we had missed all inclusive meals for the day, he advised that there was sandwiches that we could have. Rooms where very clean (room 509 on 5th Floor). Maid service was very good and towels where changed everyday. The pool is very small and only gets the sun until 1pm which i found quite annoying as i like to laze around the pool all day, but the sun terrace on the 6th floor gets the sun all day long and there is a cold water jacuzzi that you can cool down in, there is also a bar on the sun terrace. I really cant understand why alot of people where saying that the food was terrible, it was far from it. For breakfast you could have toast, cereal, fruit, yoghurt , bacon, sausages egg and beans. Lunch and dinner consisted of soup, pasta's, salads, 3types of meat/fish, vegetables, potatoes and a choice of cakes. Everyday the meats/fish was different there was never anything repeated for the 7days that we were there apart from the lasagne which we had twice and i was pleased to see it the second time becuase it was just beautiful. Tip: if you are all inclusive and heading out for the day, you can get a free packed lunch from the hotel to take with you. The hall lighting was very dull especially when you just come in from the sun. We met a guy on our first night who advised us about the cockreal which he heard every morning at around 4am which then set the dogs off from the pet shop that was next door to the hotel and that this went on all day long, But this did not happen, we heard the cockreal the odd time which did set off the dogs at times but it definatley didnt go on all day. There was a fly problem, im not sure if it was just the hotel or if it was all of malta, but we had insect repellant which we sprayed on and around our sun beds and it did help keep them away. The entertainment in the evenings was geared towards the older crowd but still we enjoyed ourselves. The staff where very friendly and very helpful. We also found the people staying at the hotel were friendly also. I would definatley reccomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice stay - do not listen to all the bad reviews !!!!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel on half board for 2 weeks and it was the worst 2 weeks of my life the bedroom was falling apart and dinner oh my god pigs dinner is better than that we ate out every night, ants everywhere mould in cafe lounge and manager is too mean to put air con on In lobby and he is so rude hated every minute of it
reviews.title: Disgusting service and hospitality

reviews.text: Having read the various reviews on this hotel, I went to Malta almost dreading what I would find. Instead, I found a clean, comfortable hotel. The food was lovely, there wasn't one meal where I couldn't find something tasty to eat. The moaning from other Brits was downright embarrassing. Yes, if you compare the hotel to 5* hotels (at 5* prices) you might be able to whinge a bit, but for what we paid, it was great value for money. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the place was spotlessly clean. My 23 year old daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we are keen to put this positive review forward for the hotel, because it is well deserved. Many of the Brits who moaned were so rude and I suspect of the "burger and chips" brigade so please don't listen to them and go and enjoy this wonderful island! :-)
reviews.title: Don't listen to the negative comments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obviously after reading the scathing reviews my girlfriend and I did not hold out much hope. On arrival we were asked to leave a 50 euro deposit and instead of the usual wrist band for AI customers we were given a swipe card - not the end of the world but when we checked out there were a couple of items on the bill not included in th AI which we had never had and the lady on the front desk took a lot of persuading before she conceded that it was not ours. The hotel did have a serious problem with flies which really got to me and the postage sized stamp swimming pool only saw the sun until 11am. There is a roof terrace where there was never a shortage of sunbeds, the jacuzzi is like a plunge pool however, but fine for a quick in and out!
reviews.title: Overall the review would be fair

reviews.text: The hotel is definately geared up for the older generation and anyone under 50 would struggle to find the entertainment enjoyable. The food was, as I have seen the manager reply, varied for different cultures and you can't please everyone, however we both found for the most part more than satisfactory and at times superb! My only criticism would be the serving times, as when on holiday you don't want to rush in the morning and last orders for breakfast are at 09:00 and dinner is only until 20:00 and when there is little to do in the hotel the only option left to you is to drink lots and lots of alcohol (house red is lovely).
reviews.title: surprised by how good it was after reeding some review

reviews.text: stayed 7th june 2011 for 7 days room on 4th floor was clean and had fresh towels and maid service every day the balcony was the size of a postage stamp only one person would fit at a time this was a superior room which ment you did not have to pay for your kettle the air con was good in the room was asked to pay 50 euros on arrival pay in cash and you get the money back in your hand on depture i did not have a problem with this beside the hotel is a cash and carry pet shop which keeps two dogs on the roof they are level with the second floor these two dogs spend most of the day barking at passing traffic and having a competion with the roosters to see who can make the most noise some times they are joined by guests from the hotel shooting at them to shut up this would happen any time between 02:30 and 08:00 spoke with the duty manager vincent regarding the noise from the zoo next door he stated that they have contacted the police who say they can do nothing and advised me to contact the tourist board . i pointed out to him that the reason the police can do nothing is because it is a civil matter and advised him to get a lawyer the staff were all very friendly and polite and were the hotels best assett the food was of poor quality because the ingredients were poor you cant make a silk purse out of a pigs ear was all inclusive but eat out 3 nights during my stay simple things like boliing potatoes and not reducing them to mush was beyond them if you want to loose weight try the toast diet for a week we did the snack bar is good for sandwiches/ chips / burgers etc but not on a sunday or hot food only up to 15:00 hrs the all inclusive bar stops at 23:00 hrs every night on a saturday the locals turn up and take over the place and there kids run wild you have been warned the hotel is not to a 4 star rating but is value for money i would give it 7 out of 10 if they get the zoo next door sorted and improve on the food i would return as for the entertainment at night the quiz night was good but the rest was geared to 60 plus age bracket if you like swimming be sure to go before 14:30 as it is now in the shade if you want to use the fitness/ sauna i think you have to break in as every time i went it was locked even loath the sigh stated open 09:00 to 17:00
reviews.title: the hotel beside the zoo

Same menu for breakfast for continuous three days. And most importantly it's far from the beach..... If you like beach a lot, don't even think of going to Kuah. Better directly reach Cenang and book a hotel. There are plenty of guest houses there for ok price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read the reviews before we booked, and decided at 350 GBP it offered good value as a base to explore Malta, as public transport was cheap, and the location approx ten minutes to Buggibba and Qawra prom. Buggibba had plenty of cheap places to eat and drink. Do go to Medina and have lunch, lovely quaint honeycombed streets of Mdina, it’s wonderfully medieval. We also visited Valletta which was interesting.
reviews.title: never going to malta again!

description: A modern newly built four star hotel with 157 rooms. All rooms are well appointed with balcony, bathroom en-suite and most rooms have picturesque country views and pool views. Room facilities include Air Conditioning, Central heating, Satellite TV, Radio, Ceiling Fan, Hair Drier, Direct Dialing Telephone,(the following at a charge) Safe, Frigo Bar and Tea & Coffee making facilities. The Highlands Restaurant serves an exciting choice of Mediterranean cuisine. Our Outdoor Swimming pool is serviced from the Pool Bar while the Roof Top Terrace having a swim spa with bar facilities during the summer period. The Mondrian café serves snacks throughout the day. Live music, 6 times weekly, is held at D` Tate Lounge Bar. The Hotel is also equipped with 3 conference rooms, Indoor Pool, Gym, Sauna, Jacuzzi, Massage Service, Internet Café, free business Internet access (Wi-Fi) and Games Room.
